A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: How was the Last Jedi disappointing? Well\, I just saw it for the first time yesterday on Christmas. I'm not a Star Wars fanatic like my 34 year old man-child son but I was a bit disappointed. I was expecting Luke Skywalker to be overly eager to accept and teach Rey in the ways of the Jedi but Luke was a major jerk! It seems that Luke is still struggling with his inner conflicts from being a young Jedi so that is why he \"sucked\" as a Jedi Master and teacher. Also\, Luke seems to be on the borderline between the light and darkness which affected his successes and failures in teaching a new Jedi generation. And the biggest disappointment\, Luke pulls a Yoda and just disappears so does this mean he is no longer part of the franchise? Well\, Carrie Fisher sadly has passed away and so we lose Mark Hamill and Carrie Fisher for the last one!? I know Abrams\, Lucas\, and other Star Wars dreamers want to conclude this whole series but you guys are killing us older and original fans from the 70's if you just leave us with Chewbacca\, R2D2\, and C3PO.
